page.title: 20INDUSTRY OF PERRANPORTH
page.content: AT THE PERRANPORTH END OF THE AIRFIELD ON A SITE BELONGING TO THE COUNCIL THERE ARE A NUMBER OF BUILDINGS.SOME OF THEM ARE USED FOR KEEPING AND MAINTAINING THE GLIDERS FROM THE {CORNISH GLIDING CLUB}BUT THERE IS ALSO SOME LIGHT INDUSTRY IN THE AREA.THE FIRM OF PERRAN ALUMINIUM WINDOWS OCCUPIES THE BUILDING WHICH WAS ORIGINALLY A MINE CHANGING ROOM AND LATER PART OF THE NOW CLOSED NOBEL GUNPOWDER FACTORY.OTHER BUILDINGS ARE USED FOR FURNITURE STORAGE AND AS A BUILDERS WORKSHOP.AT PRESENT THE COUNCIL PLANS TO DEVELOP THE AREA AS AN INDUSTRIAL ESTATE.AT THE OPPOSITE AND OF THE AIRFIELD THE CONCRETE WORKS AND SAWMILL OF COOMBE AND CARTER OCCUPY AN OLD AIRMENS BILLET WHICH WAS LATER A POULTRY HOUSE.THERE IS ALSO A WAREHOUSE CONTAINING THE TENT AND MARQUEE FIRM OF PENROSE'S.
